title: MSNBC Studio 3A — 30 Rockefeller Center

gallery.alt: LED arch wide shot — signature curved ribbon
gallery.caption: 30+ foot curved LED arch — first of its kind

gallery.alt: Anchor desk with LED front panel
gallery.caption: L-shaped anchor desk with integrated LED front panel

gallery.alt: Art Deco gold pattern wall detail
gallery.caption: Gold pattern treatments with geometric Art Deco motifs

gallery.alt: Curved LED background with discussion table
gallery.caption: Circular discussion table against curved LED backdrop
Multi-zone layout serving diverse programming formats

summary: Where 1930s Art Deco meets 40 million pixels of tomorrow. A complete reimagining of MSNBC's flagship cable news studio that honors Rockefeller Center's architectural heritage while deploying cutting-edge LED technology.
challenge: The design must honor 30 Rockefeller Center's Art Deco legacy while appearing thoroughly modern. A single studio must serve diverse formats: panels, single anchor, remote interviews, breaking news. 40 million pixels of LED require seamless scenic integration without visual seams or structural compromise.
approach: Working with Clickspring Design, Mystic translated an ambitious vision into physical reality. The design pays homage to Rockefeller Center's architectural vernacular through modern materials — deconstructed archways in light wood tones, gold accent patterns featuring repeating NBC peacock motifs, and a first-of-its-kind 30+ foot curved LED arch spanning floor-to-ceiling-to-floor.
result: Studio 3A relaunched September 20, 2021, serving MSNBC's full primetime lineup including 'Deadline: White House' and 'All In with Chris Hayes.' The Art Deco design creates distinctive identity in the competitive cable news landscape while AR/VR integration enables enhanced election coverage.

testimonial.quote: The new Studio 3A captures exactly what we envisioned — a space that honors our home at 30 Rock while giving our programming the visual canvas modern news demands. The LED arch has become our signature.
testimonial.author: NBCUniversal News Group
testimonial.title: Executive Statement
